data.text:
Portland, OR, USA

Latitude and longitude coordinates are: 45.523064, -122.676483.

Portland is the largest city in Oregon and one of the key industrial and commercial centers of the whole Pacific Region of the United States. It can be found in the north westernmost part of the country, as well as in the very north western corner of the state of Oregon. The city is located just about 45 miles away from the shores of the Pacific Ocean. Portland is built on the banks of the river of Willamette, right near the point where it meets the waters of the River Columbia. Portland is an important port and a center of business and industry. The city area is close to 133 square miles and the elevation varies between 50 feet and 11.5 hundred feet. The distance between Portland and Seattle is about 170 miles and the distance between Portland and San Francisco is about 620 miles.

Most part of the municipal area of Portland lays in the Willamette Valley and the city is surrounded by its eastern and western parts by some highlands and large forests. The city center is located in the middle of the whole municipal area and the downtown districts include Downtown Portland, South Waterfront, Goose Hollow, Pearl District, and other quarters. The neighborhoods of the city include the town of Maywood Park, the town of Gresham, and quite a large city of Vancouver situated on the opposite banks of the river of Columbia. Portland is an important center of music, arts, tourism, and business. It has a modern advanced transportation network and plenty of various social and cultural facilities.
